vHGvifi9r16F2iZ9vrqvag.text: My fav place for brisket and fish taco's. The owner Jerry is great! They smoke their own meats and salsa and the produce is local. Always good for and nice people.

xSuRfl9aQ0G_Hx2il9Fj_A.text: Not your usual bar food. Food is well prepared and very fresh. Their fried options are not dripping with oil like most bars. I have had their salads and have tried a few of their sandwiches (yum for blue dust club) and their apps are also solid. Very well stocked selection of beers. I also love how uncrowded it is, with seating never being an issue. Staff always very kind and attentive! Good bar w/ all the making of a regular hang out spot!

U5jryiIP62p2ZTi2sIiQ7w.text: This is a great neighborhood bar with an amazing selection of microbrewed beers and an original, different take on bar food.

UhAYkuj8OXNljFPw3qtV_g.text: Went for dinner with a large group. Service was very prompt and friendly, made recommendations about good selection of draft beers, including local brews. Large portions of reasonably priced food, had the three cheese sandwich. Chips and salsa come with sandwiches and are delicious, not sure if homemade or not. Impressive selection of vegetarian entrees, pretty unique for the area. Menu is surprisingly diverse, with options like daal, surf and turf sandwich, teriyaki chicken, shellfish, and falafel. Of course pub standbys like grilled sandwiches and nachos are good.

XRoljvnLJHlkWn4fgFHv_Q.text: For a great selection of micro-brew beers, I'd definitely throw this on the list.  It's a must stop before heading down to the Waterfront to do some shopping.  It's a refreshing taste of authenticity among all of the chain restaurant stops throughout the shopping area.  They have a great variety of beers on tap from all over, though it's always great to see locals being thrown in that mix!  The bartender seemed to be pretty knowledgeable about the different beers and if you're not as informed about your micro-brews, he seemed to be a great source of info!  If you don't see anything that wets your appetite out of a tap, their extensive beer cooler is bound to cure your thirst.  Though I didn't go this route, they had an intriguing idea of flavored infused vodkas.    To go with their abundance of brews, their menu had something for everyone as well.  The fish tacos were real tasty, but a little to wet.  Though I hate using it as an excuse, I was able to look past this since there were a huge group ordering just after us.  I was happy that they didn't go away from the authenticity of the tortilla.     All and all, I will definitely be a repeat offender here and wouldn't send anyone anywhere else before facing the shopping crowds!

XfQshRVaqdSKwahKTkSeVg.text: Four of us from Level Green, Pa had dinner at the Blue Dust this evening.  We were pleased with the sandwich menu and enjoyed the mushroom appetizers.  Mystery beer brew special was outstanding! Downside was the wine pricing----in a nutshell the wine @$9/glass is about 50 per cent too high!

YjbyC_OSFtsKN3PdwS-lag.text: Really like it here! We came here for drinks on a friday night and just loved the laid back, fun atmosphere. There were groups of friends, a few couples and at the bar a couple solo riders. We didn't try the food but we did try the almond butter vodka (GROSS) and the strawberry rhubarb liquor (AWESOME). Just an all around easy place, good service and reasonable prices.

Uaf7mw1kD10X3T1NEFhFlg.text: Went here because I had a coupon, well just like Jocelyn this might be my new hang out place! Loved that they made their own alcohal and when we got the bill I loved it even more!!!!!! The food was good  too, though with them having a chef that isnt a surpise! The location is awesome with being so close to the Waterfront but not having to have such a pricey meal! Definetly I will be back and will be bringing friends too!

jzYO-uA5xTgEPGPIq7ym-w.text: Great beers (at least 20+ on tap and many more in bottles), great food (especially Jerry's nuts and bell's best brown ale pierogies), and great atmosphere with a nice cozy mom and pop shop feel.  The owner Jerry is often, if not always, there entertaining and serving beers.  It's a real treat every time my boyfriend and I go down to the waterfront.  Who can beat $0.25 pierogie night on Tuesdays while washing that down with a mad elf?

u23L6W1j-Dz1e90TCutpag.text: This is my first time at the Blue Dust.  I tried their smoked brisket sandwich, and loved it.  If you like to have a big selection of drinks to choose from, this is the place for you.  You will see that they have a large selection of beer, what to drink, what to drink...

13YpMPKQiypyblXitV4Jcg.text: A group of 3 of us went last Thursday night. Overall, a good experience.  The first you'll notice is the large selection of bottles in dark/unlit coolers. This is how you know you are in a place that respects beer. Fluorescent lights skunk beer extremely quickly. Its nice to see that they know this. Anyway, we sat at the bar and looked over the 30 or so on-tap beers they have. I didn't know most of them, and the names of the beer don't help you identify what type of beer they are. Luckily, the bartender was super helpful and even gave us samples of anything we wanted. I got the Shakespeare Stout, Fatty Boomblatty (Hefeweizen) and something described as sour cherrys (forget the name). The first two were great. The last beer was a little too sour and the taste annoyed me halfway through. They also flavor their own liquor. They had Bacon Bourbon, Thai Chili/Garlic Vodka, Horseradish Vokda, and Raspberry Rum. Friends tried the bourbon. They said it was OK. Tasted more like fat than bacon.  The food was decent. I was told this was a gastropub, so I was expecting a little more. Everything was good, but not spectactular. I got the Corn Chowder. Friends got the pork tacos. Next time I go, I want to get more than soup.  Overall, great friendly service (bartender understood our 'death by snu snu' Futurama reference, which was awesome), terrific beer selection, decent food.

4bT-3uCn35BuJ0DyrRECcQ.text: Last winter a friend took me to the Blue Dust after a late night shopping trip, and I fell in love with it instantly.  I loved the decor and the staff.    In February, I ended up moving to Duquesne and the Blue Dust is my new haunt.  I'm from New York, originally, and I'm particular about my pastrami.  Happy to report that their pastrami lives up to an east side NY deli!  They also do a delicious Falafel -- moist with a flaky/crunchy ouside (almost like Panko).    The staff is awesome and so is the clientele.  I go there often and have met some fun people.  And if you're a Train Spotter, you'll be more than delighted!

4G7HXBds3CWabBhtpddryg.text: My favorite bar in Pittsburgh!  The beer selection is ALWAYS outstanding. The cocktails are delicious. The food is also amazing. And they have my favorite bartenders around. They are all friendly, knowledgable, and good at their jobs!  I recommend the Blue Dust to everybody I know. Its now my moms favorite bar too!

bBlKx1IN3P8uUIFPW6jyOA.text: Blue Dust is one of those "hidden" Pittsburgh gems I bring people to if they are visiting the city or can't figure out "hey, where should we eat?"   It really has something for everyone. First, the beer selection is great. There's about two dozen seasonal beers on tap, plus loads more in the cooler. BD also has a small menu of handcrafted cocktails, some of which include their homemade liquors!   There's a monthly list of specials which always includes seasonal and local ingredients. You will also find a handful of vegetarian (and sometimes even vegan) options.   The soup changes daily, and almost all of them are winners (try the curried crab bisque!).  As for my favorites from the main fare, I simply cannot resist the Homestead Surf and Turf, a half pulled pork, half crab sandwich which comes with barbecue sauce and horseradish sauce respectively. As a side, one can choose from the yummy fresh coleslaw or chips and salsa. I will also add that this, along with just about everything else on the menu, is a very healthy portion of food.   The food and drink really make up a four-star review. What I like about Blue Dust is the atmosphere, the diverse clientele, and the service.  Patrons range from athletes fresh off the Homestead bike path to elderly folks coming from a day of shopping from the waterfront. Servers are always attentive, friendly, and have interesting stories to tell.  Did you know Frank (the bartender and manager) is an incredibly talented comic book artist? If you ever need to have a meal or drink alone, never fear about heading into Blue Dust solo. Pull up a seat at the bar and meet some wonderful people.

iZwPEXzv1lU5yWfvOaTiWA.text: Excellent choice of bar food, sandwiches, draft beer and craft cocktails.   Off the beaten path but worth it.   Very will priced too.  Recommend to anyone not wanting to visit a chain place close by to Homestead.

oh7Hpuyvk3N4_56xueZ3DA.text: Crab sandwich is trash...it's like half tuna fish...gross...only been there once got my food to go...won't go back

eqq5c5dgg9a1UvCfk1hW4g.text: Based on the outside, I wouldn't have chosen this restaurant but it was recommended.  I'm glad we tried it.  The service was good. The server was knowledgeableabout the beer selection. I had fish tacos and thought they were good.  My husband had pork and thought they were bland.  He wasn't a fan of the salsa (thought this was bland too).  I liked it although it wasn't anything special.

CVEgdGBEqEHAACy7Zl4erQ.text: It smells like I am getting cancer.  This is my second time and the smell is really weird.  Food and service was fine though.

FZFuQgsrZtsIrlRmzk4z0A.text: Beer selection is great but pricy and food was disappointing. I really wanted to like it but I don't think I'll be coming back.

K0ZiEEi2ykWHC77Abn9Omw.text: I love it here. Food is so delish!!! The craft beer selection is extensive. Service is always on point. Thank you, Stephanie!   Try a horse radish & pickled vodka bloody mary. Their salsa and chips are to die for!   Blue Dust always has cool monthly specials!   The atmosphere is very chill & hip.   Come see for yourself, you'll be back!

6XEHSWT6Nlujym7sd8rRmw.text: Low expectations exceeded. The chill vibe and the unassuming decor might lead you to expect typical prepared bar food... You'd be wrong. The Menu is not extensive but that's because the selected items were carefully considered to balance and complement one another perfectly. Well seasoned  and prepared just right. I'll go back and can't wait!

TewQySSh73L6ETIR_JOLMQ.text: You know the little dive bar, right by the tracks on your way to the Waterfront?  The place you have driven by 20K times and never thought to actually stop in cause it's a dive bar?  Hold on to your seats, folks, cause this isn't a dive bar.   It's actually a freaking fantastic watering hole and surprisingly healthy and inventive pub.  One of my friends stopped by here and wrote something on facebook about it that made me think it was worth my while and it was way better than even expected.   The hubby and I decided to split everything after ordering some beers - cranberry ale for me (not nearly cranberry-ish enough) and a Bell's Christmas White for him (excellent choice).  Their menu is a mix of reasonably healthy and nice and awesomely naughty - perfect for the holidays.  We started with the fried zucchini which we use as a bit of a guide as we eat our way around Pittsburgh.  Almost everyone has it, almost everyone does it horribly, horribly wrong.  Blue Dust was a fabulous exception.  The zucchini appeared to have been picked that day, it was sliced super thin and breaded and deep-fried to perfection.  It was served on a bed of lettuce which did pretty-up the plate, but also served to soak up the grease.    We then asked to split the lamb chili.  I assumed we would be given two spoons and a "go for it" kind of attitude, but they actually split the order in two and gave us two orders of the delicious garlic bread that accompanied it.  It was amazing!  Seriously amazing.  It was just lamb-y enough that you knew that you were eating lamb, but not so lamb-y that you were wondering if you were on the farm.  It was slightly spicy and really just a perfect winter meal.    We also split the sliders - crab, smoked turkey and brisket.  They were all amazing.  Very different and very tasty.  They came with local-made chips and a fantastic smoked tomato salsa that I really could have had a massive jar of to take home.   Unfortunately, between the 2 and 3 course, I discovered the liquor menu.  Infused root beer bourbon?  Infused chai vodka?  A mixed drink with Crabbie's ginger beer?  Why didn't I look at you earlier???  We will be back.  Many, many, many times.  A must stop on your way to the Waterfront.

j8CmYTsM95WDAp8ukXRCqA.text: We absolutely LOVE this place!! The food is wonderful and I can't say enough about the employees! It is great to find servers that LOVE where they work and it shines through in every aspect of this local bar/restaurant. Forget about the chain restaurants at the Waterfront and go eat at this little gem in Homestead! The fish taco was the best I have ever tasted. the fish is NOT fried and the flavors seemed to be infused even into the center of the filet. I had the pleasure of trying the passion fruit mead. Mead is an acquired taste and this flavor perfect to overcome any strong honey taste. We cannot wait to return!

786rmRrYiBiu13SBmYxU8A.text: Short version: Cheap, delicious, friendly, unique. Get the crab curry soup.  Longer version: Oh sweet, loving, though possibly non-existent God; this place is unfortunately hidden yet wonderfully comforting. I wish I could try everything. My only option, obviously, is to go back in order to try everything.  I went with a few friends on  Tuesday night after having to go to the Verizon store at the Waterfront and not really wanting to eat at Red Robin (nothing wrong with Red Robin, though). They had 25 cent pierogies on special--obviously, we had 25 of them. They were perfectly browned, crisp on the edges, and after a little searching we managed to find the pile of onions that they were cooked with. The spinach artichoke dip was equally delicious, leading me to have faith in the other appetizers as well.  For our main course, we all ended up splitting crab curry soup, fried zucchini, and the surf'n'turf (half of a crabcake sandwich and half of a house-smoked brisket sandwich). They had a sweet collection of craft beers on tap and the dude who served us was probably the nicest person I've ever met within the food industry. The crab curry soup was simple and exactly the dish I'd go back for.  I can't wait to go back and explore the rest of what Blue Dust has to offer.

VOoSgt7ENZUGAf-1U0XP0g.text: Great place to eat with a marvelous beer selection.  The food is homemade and delicious.  The staff are welcoming and friendly.  I have been here to eat many times and I have never been disappointed.

h6-EWWyzvTXdIJWWyz8C4Q.text: Just had a Black Bean Hummus dip that was AMAZING! Please put it on your regular menu, cause it's fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Black Bean Hummus that was too good to pose!

fkok4LBeGuVWhRUeVKtJTg.text: In a word WOW! came here after reading the other yelp reviews and all I can say is I am glad I did. I had the salmon special and it was really good the fish was nice and fresh not some frozen patty like the food chains, the potatoes were real and so was the spinach. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was because I am not a big micro brew guy and when I asked what they had they just point to a giant chalk board in the back. When you have over 20 micro brews on tap a little help would have been nice. I didn't ask for help nor did they offer so you can take that one as you want. How can you beat a killer Salmon dinner and a couple of beers for 26 Bucks?

VNsqd46ey9QsvafyhtFamg.text: This place has an awesome food and beer selection. There are great food and beer happy hour and daily specials.  Tuesday is pirogie night and so worth going.

8HoGZlZ1xPfbhikqyrXu-Q.text: I wanted to love this place.  Fantastic beer selection, not merely the standard local crafts. According to their website they have 25 cent pierogies on Tuesdays.  Got here promptly at 6 PM; was informed they are "out of pierogies". This made me sad. Frowny face. I was super hungry.

5hy47lB1K7-_bB2c2lQ98A.text: Great neighborhood bar vibe & feel. Plenty of character here, very solid beer selection, funky drink concoctions, and a killer menu.  Just on the outskirts of the Waterfront, but the best choice in the area for a drink or a bite.

Or5dby9CASjZYowvge5L-g.text: I guarantee that this is going to be one of my favorite bars here.  It wasn't crowded.  It wasn't so noisy that I couldn't enjoy my very tasty (and correctly poured) Guinness that was only $2.50 a pint on Wednesdays.  The staff was nice.  Everyone seemed to know "Jerry," who I must assume is the owner.  The selection of beer was great.  I even like the way the trains passed by.  And the hubs, who is almost never impressed by things, said that his brisket was possibly the best he's ever had.  I had a crab roll that was pretty darn tasty as well.  Can't wait to become a regular!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. The bar at Blue Dust.

wMNnCEO0i-cVHdNqsmqZqw.text: Great atmosphere, great service, excellent beer selection, and outstanding food! Love everything we have ever eaten here. The tacos are amazing and you can never go wrong ordering the special of the day.  Highly recommend for great beers and even better food.

JXiB42kpHjdnIEA2vkWn9g.text: Great beer list and cooler. Great prices during happy hour.  I love the huluski here. Big fat noodles and cabbage with onions for only $1, can't beat that price. They have rotating menu with specials listed for each month. Last month i had the tilapia sandwich which was AMAZing!! Lots of flavor, not overly fried and all the veggies taste fresh.  They shop for a lot of food locally and offer healthy choices to fried foods plus they have a lot of meals you cant really get other places. My husband ordered the chicken stir-fry which was so good and they give you plenty of food for leftovers.   Took my mom here and she enjoyed it as well, even had a kids menu for grilled cheese and PBnJ sandwiches. I wanted to try some of their exoctic liquor. I dont drink whiskey or bourbon but they had a root beer flavored one so I thought what they heck. Unfortunately they had run out before i could taste it. Oh well..  I'll probably be dining their tonight and watch the pens game.

bisemoLE0BPdIOWpKrWbog.text: Great vibe! Great food! Great beer selection! Great joint overall. We stopped in at Burgatory...2.5hr wait.....PF Changs...1.5hrs.... I'm glad we missed out on those two. Blue dust is just way more fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

ptM_rBQe0NjCTVX94-s8AQ.text: We were in town for the night and are sooooooo tired of the usual chain restaurant fare that we were surrounded by, like Chan's, etc. in the waterfront area. Since my guy grew up in Pittsburgh, I jumped on Yelp to hopefully find something unique with funky creative food close to us. Neither of us felt like fighting the crowds and traffic in the Strip District.     I hit a home run with this gem I came up with! We loved the feel and friendliness of the place from the minute we saddled up at the bar. Gastro pub is the perfect description of what they do here! I ordered the pulled park sammy and it was just amazing! They smoke all their own pork and brisket right there. The sauces and accompaniments are also made in house. What a breath of culinary heaven!     Price is great, food amazing, staff friendly. We officially have a new hang out when were in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Porkzilla sammy is the bomb!

SzJjReelYzO0lCWwWHeN2w.text: Stopped by with a friend for a beer. Great Lakes lager on tap was well appreciated on a hot day. Waitress was very nice and we had a great time talking. I noticed all the craft beer on tap and I will return.

eHtjp6Yf-Cm7VNCFgAWcPw.text: Met a friend for lunch that, like me, had not been to BD in quit a long time.   If you are into beers, this is a great spot. Like some of the brownish mural type painting on the wall along with the big old bar.   Our server was the bartender who was handling the entire place, was very nice and efficient.  Did forget my soup, until reminded.  The Curry Crab soup was very good with a lot of curry and crab flavor.  The Eric Poster Tacos of pulled pork on corn shells (two tacos) were large and topped with fresh salsa and scallions.  The meat had a nice smoke flavor and was very juicy...sloppy to eat.   Nice place for a cold one and a good meal.

0eqUqk8zUYoqpJ6bViOR5Q.text: We stopped in to get a bite to eat after staying three nights on the Waterfront. We had read some reviews but we're kind of leery about stopping in because it kind of looked like a dicey redneck type of bar.... What we experienced was an amazing craft beer selection a very interesting and delicious dinner with fried eggplant with horseradish sauce, a blue dust salad and chicken stir fry.... The pumpkin spice cake with caramel sauce was amazing and so moist and light...our waitress was the baker of this amazing concoction.... I really recommend the Blue Dust! Never judge a book by its cover....even if it is covered with dust....blue dust

H6dC-bVJ0dCWW23pR-UiSg.text: This place is a divey joint! The atmosphere is great from the friendly bartender staff to the autograph wall! Before enjoying dinner, I ordered a strawberry mojito which was absolutely amazing! It tickled my taste buds! It wasn't too strong but just fruity and alcoholic enough! After my delicious mojito, I had the Homestead Surf and Turf which is a half brisket half crab sandwich and I got horseradish sauce for dipping. The brisket and crab were to die for and the horseradish sauce was absolutely fantastic! Honestly, I could not ask for a better experience here! I'd recommend this hole in the wall joint to anyone!

raSZdlUbGT45NCuYHDbUew.text: Had dinner tonight at the Blue Dust. I had the Brontosaurus short rib, my husband had the brisket taco's and my son had the cheese steak. Let's just say there wasn't much talking through dinner! We all just loved our entree 's! Even the starters were amazing! We had the red pepper humus and the orzo mushroom. We all agreed we will be back soon! The atmosphere was nice and the service was great. We highly recommend!

Sh1p65XZYquhW3z0jhVaiQ.text: I'd like to think that my review will be final after I've tried 3 or 4 dishes on random days. The food here can, overall, be a hit or miss. They're undoubtedly novel and well thought out, but at times aren't executed particularly well. The mac and cheese I had last week really was the best I've ever tasted, but the expensive shrimp scampi pasta I had the week after wasn't worth the price.  The "casino butter" just tasted like oil without any parsley or hint of lemon. The garlic bread was slightly burnt as well. I appreciate the number of large shrimp in the dish and the decent amount of spinach, but I would not fork over $15 for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Shrimp scampi pasta (monthly special)

T4oRGwGaFglSGgqNcjCHfw.text: Like other reviewers, I've driven past Blue Dust countless times but never actually stopped in. My husband and I finally stopped in last night for a happy hour dinner and we loved it! The staff was super friendly which is always a bonus. Great drink and beer list (still regretting not getting the fall sangria but my Ottercreek beer was delicious!) as well as a creative and delicious menu. We started with hummus and finished with sandwiches; everything was served quickly and really hit the spot. We headed out afterwards to a different bar for drinks but both kind of wished we would have stayed at Blue Dust - so obviously we'll be back!

RSTIq_T14UxEMGVdafBDHg.text: I love a funky bar when it has a good beer selection and decent food. This place does it with loads of character. Check it out!

fg9qD7Ozlz3Bv63EzSC7mQ.text: I've now been twice and I give it 5 stars. It's a trendy, kind of small, but amazing beer selections. Per Frank, the bartenders recommendations we had these amazing bloody mary's with pickled infused vodka and horseradish infused vodka that they do in-house . He made the experience 5-star. Discussed the underground pinball league in Pittsburgh and was really enthusiastic about Pittsburgh in general.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

R8p1dN0cMQkOddMy74-A8Q.text: The food was alright. The best part of my meal was definitely the soup. The atmosphere is a bit grungy but not uninviting. We came for lunch on a Friday so i can not attest to how the bar scene is on a weekend. The beer selection is good. They had founder's all day on tap which for the Pittsburgh area isn't the easiest to find on tap. Overall, blue dust wasn't bad.

4_lUSuJ70DM4zSKARs5b3w.text: I stopped by last night before seeing a movie at the Waterfront, due to the convenience of the location and having a City Dining Card for this place.  Given the high ratings, I was expecting a solid meal here. Unfortunately, however, this place failed to deliver on several counts.  Our visit got off to a shaky start when CM and I walked in and seated ourselves, per the instructions of the sign at the host stand. We sat at a table close to the front, and after perusing the menu for several minutes, nobody came to greet us.  We eventually approached to the bar to order, and the bartender apologized and said he hadn't seen us come in, and someone finally came to provide us with another menu and table service. When our waiter came to take our order, we ordered the red bean dip to share, my dining partner ordered the brisket tacos, and I ordered the lobster roll, which came to $34. Thankfully, the food came out pretty quickly after ordering.  In my opinion, the bean dip, which was thick and savory, and came with tortilla chips, was the best thing we ordered.  Although I didn't try CM's tacos since I don't eat beef, he mentioned they had so much meat that they were difficult to eat.  Despite this, he enjoyed them, however.  As for the lobster roll, one bite revealed that the toast was burnt.  Despite habitually taking photos, I'm not in the habit of inspecting my food closely before eating it, since I've never been served something burnt before, and the lighting wasn't the best.  Because the toast on the other half of the sandwich wasn't burnt as badly, I was famished, and service wasn't the most attentive, I ate it.  The lobster seemed a bit tough, and the ingredients weren't super-flavorful, but it was okay.  Both entrees came with tortilla chips, as well as a oniony salsa that I wasn't a fan of.  After about 10 min., our server returned to check on us, and I pointed out the burnt bread, and he offered to rectify it by either making anther sandwich or bringing fresh bread.  Because I was halfway through the sandwich, I chose the latter.  While he should never have served me a sandwich with burnt bread, I do give him credit for fixing the situation.  During the time that we were there, a weekly stand up comedy show that occurs during this time (8-10pm) was going on.  Although I had noticed that this would be the case, I forgot to mention it to CM.  Neither of us are huge stand up comedy fans, but one of the comedians was funny--the others were varying degrees of awkward.  The show is free, though.  It's possible that the presence of the show may have detracted from our service, but I can't say for sure.  Overall, I was disappointed in my experience at Blue Dust, although I do give them credit for correcting the burnt toast issue.  Perhaps the food tastes better once you've had a few beers, but for my part, I wasn't super-impressed. I'd be willing to give this place a second chance, but it'll probably be awhile before I do so.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Lobster roll--note burnt toast
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Brisket tacos
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Red bean dip and tortilla chips

TkvEN6H55kg3dHEULUjJRA.text: After scrolling through Yelp, we found this place with a pretty good rating and decided to test it out for ourselves. It turned out to be a rather disappointing experience. We started with the Spicy China Doll which was a lentil dip with Indian spices. Aside from the fact that the name choice is awful (i.e. China is not India), it was served with pita that was basically paper. The dip was okay, but not spicy at all -- coming from someone who considers black pepper spicy. Afterwards, I had the Heat n' Honey Teriyaki Chicken Wrap, but subbed out the chicken for tofu. I do give them props for making their menu as vegetarian friendly as possible. The tofu tasted great, but it was 70% wrap and 30% filling - not my ideal ratio. It was served with a side of "cole slaw" aka shredded cabbage in a balsamic-like dressing. Not exactly what I was expecting. The other option for a side is chips and salsa (no fries? really??). Overall, not a place I would come back to.

EXo94c98k35wiWZPH6b2lw.text: The Blue Dust is my "go to" place for craft beer, good food, and a relaxed atmosphere. I'm on a first name basis with the owner and most of the bartenders. There's very little that I can add that hasn't already been mentioned in other post on here. I'll just reinforce that it's a great spot to be at on a Tuesday evening with the 25 cent pirogues, the $2.50 Mystery Draft (always a good beer), and the amateur stand-up comedy that shows up around 8:30. Forget the chains across the tracks and stop into the Blue Dust.
