Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Mission IPA

SWmSt-DJr5xXi2g188ApMw.text: I've been meaning to get here and try their food for some time and I am quite happy I finally got the chance. The menu isn't that big, but the selections are great to choose from.  While browsing over the menu to pick out exactly what I wanted to nosh on I had another hard decision to make: what to drink?  They have so much on tap that it's boggling to pick from. 27 I believe. If you're not sure what to try, you can purchase a sampler. For this particular visit I wasn't in the mood for a beer and decided to go for the hard stuff. Now at any typical bar this would be an easy decision to make, but this is not your typical place. I mean who would thought to make a vodka infused with pickles?  Or horseradish even?  I wasn't that daring to try one of those but something did catch my eye. Root beer bourbon. Yes, I did say root beer bourbon. I asked the bartender what was best to mix with it and was advised to try it mixed with ginger ale. Such a wise bartender you are my lady.  It tasted like a root beer float for adults!  Now onto the food. My friend and I ordered finally ordered after all those hard decisions.  We had the fried zucchini as an appetizer. Beer battered is always the way to go. Only bad thing, I think it may have been fried too long. The coating was hard as hell on some parts. I opted for the fish tacos and was not disappointed.  Grilled tilapia with shredded red cabbage and a sauce with cilantro in it. Delicious. Have it a spritz from the lime that came on the side and that made it ever so better.  Each item comes with a side of tortilla chips and salsa.  My friend had the falafel platter and she devoured it.   This place definitely deserves a return visit. And not just because of the food. The staff are so welcoming that you feel the need to return.

w3gXsk6hrJuoJ3czFIZpGQ.text: I'm a sucker for a divey place with good eats and this definitely fits both.   Fish tacos were surprisingly amazing...and complemented by the salsa and chips.   My mojito was refreshing.   The hubs had a brisket sandwich that was solid, but not as good as my selection.  He loved the craft beer selection though.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Fish tacos.   Yum

HgrZM8aTx99yHMIWWTTFeA.text: Great service, excellent beer, interesting and mouth watering food. Next time in Pittsburgh, I'm definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. So many beers to try.

ZY8gDQ1PTx97amsnB7ryiA.text: I recently moved to the Waterfront and had driven past Blue Dust numerous times before finally stopping in on a Sunday afternoon. Since then, I have been to Blue Dust on three occasions now and am very impressed.  This restaurant combines reasonably priced food, great craft beer selection, and a friendly atmosphere. Oh and let's not forget the unbelievable Bloody Mary's with your choice of dill or horseradish infused vodka.   I have had the pulled pork tacos and the beef brisket.  Both were excellent and cooked to perfection.  The meat was tender and flavorful with reasonable portions at a good price. The service is always very friendly and timely. This is a great spot to take a date or just a place to stop in for a pint of your favorite craft beer after work.

8u-cXJG2y8eAR_2T94QliA.text: Finally made it to this gem by the Waterfront - formerly known as a culinary wasteland of chain restaurants and long lines. After a soul-crushing time slogging through the Waterfront parking lots, this watering hole on the other side of the tracks is an oasis with its plentiful good beers on tap. I was surprised by the lack of burgers, but if you're in the mood for a meaty sandwich the brisket sandwich was devoured by our neighbor at the bar. We opted for the nachos and pork tacos for an abundance of good bar food with a highlight of clearly home-made salsa. The name of the game at Blue Dust is "home-made" with their jars of treats sprinkled around the bar from cherry peppers stuffed with cheese and soppressata to bacon-infused vodka.   The atmosphere is bright and clean - with lots of windows and plants - not common for a bar. The bartender's laid-back joking attitude dressed in a floral Hawaiian shirt really set the tone. The crowd for a Saturday lunch was a friendly mix of regulars from all walks of life and ages. Overall, this is a great little neighborhood spot in a struggling neighborhood.

fyfs7rsgcHs4TwuyB_xAnw.text: Blue Dust features a large selection of decent beers, an appealing and clean atmosphere, pleasant service, and good food. They have a large draft list written on the blackboard which changes frequently, as well as coolers for you to mix and match your own sixpack for a reasonable price. The waiters have always been extremely friendly, and the bar has a laid-back dark cool relaxing atmosphere. PS: Non-smoking!  The fish tacos were amongst the best I've had in Pittsburgh and the China Doll appetizer was superb. They also have decent chips and salsa, a great Portabella mushroom wrap and ginger carrot soup. On my last visit I had a delicious beer called the "Duck Rabbit Milk."

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

1nGYd-GAxcdMHh9_8bo0jg.text: Don't order the nachos! They were mediocre at best. Our bartender/server was a poor listener and had to be told more than once what drinks/food had been ordered. She was not busy on the Saturday afternoon we were there. Will try Blue Dust again as any bar/restaurant can have an off day. Can anyone suggest a can't miss item on the menu?

gQ96ffeH-eIX3C4KKn4f3w.text: my boyfriend and i had stayed with his cousin the night before and asked him where would be good for brunch/lunch. he suggested blue dust, as it's one of his favorite places to go. he told us about the owner, who was quite a character, and the bartender, stephanie, who liked to "stephanize" people by telling stories and entertaining them. we arrived and the two of them had bloody marys. i'm personally not a fan, but they said they were delicious. we started with one of the january specials, a black bean hummus appetizer. very tasty. i had the corn seafood chowder (a-ma-zing! spicy and flavorful!) and the stir fry. i wouldn't say the stir fry was anything amazing or particularly notable, but it was good, and i would eat it again. the place looks almost like a mix between a dive-bar and a diner, but it's definitely worth stopping out for a bite, as there is quite a mix of menu options, the prices are reasonable, and the food is overall, really pretty good. oh, and! if you're into infused alcohols, they make their own and several kinds!

TWf5GYtN2Gt3Lcx_xkHBzw.text: Great place. I had a delicious pork sandwich with just the right balance of pork, sauce, and bread, crispy cole slaw, and a refreshing  sour beer called the smutty dog. More importantly, it had a great atmosphere. It's not the most crowded bar, but don't let that fool you. It's a great place to go for a relaxing time, a sandwich, and a beer.

c9iEr-hL2cx3LWLpEPZTDQ.text: I took the waiter's advice on my beer and my sandwich & I was not disappointed! Such an amazing meal, nice beer selection and reasonably priced.

iZqfWph62C-yO2_0izLYXQ.text: It's doesn't live up to the hype in many ways. The drinks are decent but very overpriced. Some of the flavor infused alcohols are weaker than others. The food is mediocre and the bartenders were borderline rude. It was a C- experience that certainly didn't live up to the reputation.

vcuCBqHN71uG8CU9A8LQQA.text: After hearing about this palace  for a while, I decided to stop in. It was a Saturday night and the place was fairly empty.  We sat ourselves and a waiter came up to us shortly thereafter. I asked for a beer list, but was told that the only beer list was on a chalkboard on a wall in the middle of the restaurant. Not a big deal if it was visible from all of the tables, but it wasn't.  If I wanted to look at it, I had to stand in the middle of the room. Not terrible I suppose, but quite awkward to say the least. Instead of trying to memorize the beer list or continue to stand in the middle of the room, I decided to not have a beer at all. I went for a cocktail, and ordered the blue dust old fashioned. It wasn't very remarkable in any way. While it wasn't bad, it didn't stand out as a signature cocktail for having a bunch of house infused ingredients. I thought it was a bit overpriced for what I got. Our food started off with the spicy China doll app and it was so damn good! The dip had so much flavor!! I had the Pastor taco's and I felt the same about them. They were super flavorful and there was plenty of filling. My girl had the chicken club and it was average as far as chicken clubs go...kinda hard to mess one of those up. Over all it was an average experience Nothing was terrible, but there really wasn't anything that would make me want to go back either.

otdnUvmEZCsuStCmMmt3jg.text: We went to this restaurant, two mother-daughter pairs, for dinner before a 7:15 movie.  The bar-like environment and under-stated exterior would normally have deterred us, but we were seated by a friendly server within about 10 minutes.  It was truly a hometown Pittsburgh hang-out with all ages patronizing the place.  We ate the smoked chicken tacos and the reuben.  They were great, and our waitress was able to tell me that the chicken dish was gluten-free (having just been checked the night before for another customer).  The food arrived in a timely manner, with enough time to get to the movie theatre on time.  We will return.

iv_o_BA4p1vcIt9gVQUHQQ.text: Great variety of draft beers. We had the 3 sliders combo, Porklilla and smoked brisket all were amazing. Might have been the best pulled pork I've ever had. Don't be fooled by the way it looks from the street. This place is top notch.

TLupQW0IGN21zo50aBPxmA.text: Service wasn't very good, and I honestly don't expect much at tables in a bar.  Friendly, but slow service (because inefficient, not because he wasn't around much).  Forgot drink order and waited 30 minutes total before getting a beer, even though the place was barely half-full when we got there.  This is a bar, the food we had was quite unremarkable.  Turkey Rueben at $10 should be high quality meat, high quality bread, etc.  It was el-cheapo thin rye bread from the grocery store, dry bland turkey and cheap dressing on top.  This was a $4 version.  I order this sandwich (or the original version of it) many places so I'm no stranger to it.  Cool atmosphere, good beer selection, good vibe.  Go for the beer, skip the food.

0rqSwMDBDMvp2dkGmz8o0A.text: What a gem! Great food - especially the pulled pork nachos! Awesome beer selection on tap & interesting specialty blended vodkas like chai horseradish and pickle! Oh and bacon bourbon!!! Nice staff too!

zaoF-4gwTaBSxhdVORYxZQ.text: Great place for beer.  The owner's motto is "No crap on tap".  That is so True.  He has picked a wide variety of beers that cater to almost anyone with a decent taste for beer. The wait staff is very good and knowledgeable about the different beers.  I think they must have tried most of them because they seem so up-to-date with the knowing about the different tastes.  The food is good here too.  My wife and I go here often for the Happy Hour on Friday for the half priced drafts.    The owner is usually present each time we have gone.  He seems to have a True interest in his establishment and cares about the customers.   The only small drawback is the outdoor seating is limited and the trains come by too often.  The trains are just noisy.  Other than that, we love this place!

a9fyubiZzc_7G_7sh6Buaw.text: *A Great Joint for a Couple of Obscure Draft Beers!*  Myself and a few girlie-friends stopped in here to continue a little low-key night out for drinks...  it was nice!  The bartender was a friendly younger girl that was very nice and took good care of us.  PROS: TONS of draft beer selection!! Kinda low-key and mellow (a plus in my book); Bathrooms were cleanish, too.  CONS: Parking is a bit limited; Jukebox is a CD style Juke, so the selection is limited.  [I will update this after I've tried to the food; I *hear* that the food is great!]

HYX723slu7G15yNFOWpsAw.text: For a bar this place has exceptional food. Highly recommend the fish tacos and the portabella wrap. Be mindful they serve these dishes with chips and salsa, so if you don't like chips (like me) ask for another side. The mac and cheese is ok- a bit greasy. I don't recommend the beer battered mushrooms unless you like greasy, fried food. Apparently they have a good selection of beer here (so I've been told)- but I don't like beer so I don't have any recommendations.

kw9OeyszM6FXM8iOi4ORrQ.text: Stopped in before a concert in Homestead. Met by friendly server who told me about happy hour (half off draughts!) Despite getting busy, server was attentive, friendly, on top of drinks (beer and water refills) and the food was pretty good! The beer selection was incredible and the prices were reasonable for the quality of the beer. Then, there was the happy hour so it was very inexpensive. Incredible first experience there, will be heading to Homestead just to go there.

ywU08LQ8rWu-bmhKPryVBQ.text: A great place to meet.  Tons of micro brews.  Horseradish vodka, Bloody Mary. Yummy! The food is locally grown & delicious. Weds. Is Guiness night.  Vegetarians, vegans and meatlovers will enjoy the varied menu. Try it-you"ll go back again.

ZTXC1_DakokS-iiEgZ9fgQ.text: Beer - always excellent, goes without saying.  Service - wonderful, they know what they are doing.  Food - it's obviously a passion.  I had the Shrimp and Grits last night - outstanding.  The addition of horseradish to the grits was magical, and the shrimp was perfectly grilled.  I think that should be a standard on the menu.  Just saying........ And maybe the smoked pork chop and polenta......  Hey a girl can wish, right?

8A923pOIkqC6dNDKnfulvg.text: No crap on tap. Best happy ahr n' tahn. The food is tasty too. This place is good for hipsters and regular folk. Try one of 20+ microbrews on draft and make sure you say hello to Jerry. Oh and try a Bloody Mary on Sunday. The house made mix tastes like a fresh garden.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

3ilW6rAfH9WuJ2jAcS_Zjw.text: Blue dust was a great find. Its never over crowded, even on the weekends. I would of gave this 5 stars but Im not a fan of their food. Almost everything has smoked infused flavoring and its just too overpowering. Otherwise, great little place!

XyQEhNjxr0UiFsioRAU3Rg.text: Finally got a chance to stop in here after many years of just not making it a priority. Nice local bar feel. It was during lunch so it wasn't too loud. Liked the decor and the setup . Enjoyed the beer selection on draft very much, great craft choices. Lots of bottles to pick from in the coolers as well. I tried the sliders of pastrami, pulled pork and brisket. Honestly the only one that was even half good was the pulled pork. All sauces were on the side if u wanted some. All sandwiches served with plain tortilla chips and smoked salsa. I didn't like the salsa in any way. It was kinda weird to me. It's now off my list of places to go.

WDNpViDZ2u64B2Y3Cxac5w.text: So- I have driven past this past a thousand times and never thought to stop here, until I saw that I had a city dining card for it. My boyfriend and I were apprehensive about coming, considering from the outside it looks like any other typical dive bar. But we gave it a chance and I am really glad we did.   It's adorable inside.. They had a ton of awesome beers on tap, I had the Great Lakes Lake Erie monster :). They have house infused vodkas including pickle, expresso and even horse radish.. How unique? We went on a Sunday evening, it was dead. Our server was incredibly friendly. I was surprised by their menu, they had a ton of vegan and vegetarian options even though they are famous for their pulled pork. My boyfriend and I started off with the red bean dip- incredible. Next, we got two house salads- they came with spring greens, almonds and cranberries, nothing too crazy but yet very delicious. My boyfriend ordered the pulled pork sandwich - awesome, really sweet BBQ sauce although I wasn't a huge fan of the aged provolone. I got the veggie wrap with portabellas, zucchini and peppers- messy but amazing.  Overall, this place is awesome and I loved it. I absolutely plan on going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Portabella mushroom wrap with their house made slaw
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. House salad
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Red bean dip

CsrwKySAd1VfLj8y8vuzww.text: I've passed this place millions of times heading to the Waterfront for years. I never once thought about it until Meghan B. gave me the suggestion! After Yelping it, I realized I was missing out! Who knew this gem stood right next to the Waterfront's railroad tracks!  Tony W. and I finally had a chance to check it out last week for a late Anniversary meal (yes, we're classy like that). The atmosphere was very welcoming. It wasn't that busy so it gave us a relaxed feel. The bar takes up about half of the space and the rest of the area is reserved for tables. They also have a nice outdoor seating area, where that set up about eight to ten tables.   They have such a unique beer list, so we decided on a flight (only $11)! I'm so bad at remembering names, but our favorite was the grapefruit. It was so refreshing! Light, but still enough to get us a little twisted, hehe!   Their menu is unique as well. Everything is very carefully thought out and they offer many vegan/vegetarian options as well as small and dishes/tapas. I ordered the chicken club sandwich with a side of cole slaw. WOW! The sauce and chicken were perfect. They definitely weren't cheap with the meat as they loaded it with thick bacon as well. I wasn't crazy about the cole slaw as it was too vinegar-y.   This is definitely a gem and I hope more people catch on! This is a wonderful alternative to the chain restaurants in the Waterfront. They also offer really great specials throughout the week. I saw a pierogi night! Nice! Can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Beer flight. My favorite was the grapefruit!
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Chicken club with cole slaw.
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Hot Italian sausage sandwich with chips and salsa.

qxnZG6voHaGxGUCSoPq5nw.text: You would never guess the food that you can get at this restaurant just by looking at its exterior and interior. Aside from its 20+ beers on tap, Blue Dust offers great food that is not your typical "bar food."   Fried Zucchini: Unlike some of the more typical renditions of this app, the fried zucchini here is thin like a potato chip and is fried in beer batter. Stirfry: Heaping vegetables with brown rice in an Asian-style sauce! Being Asian myself, my standards are pretty high, and I loved this dish here (definitely not authentic, but very tasty!). Smoked Brisket Sandwich: Smoked brisket with BBQ sauce with aged provolone. I thought that the bread:meat ratio was a little off, but the brisket was delicious! It came with a side of tortilla chips and house salsa that was refreshing.  BD is definitely on my list of "to return" before I leave Pittsburgh. They also offer other inventive dishes and have rotating specials!

0Nv8dfn5fs6fSkRtL2GFYA.text: Ho hum.  I'm bored.  I'm afraid the phrase "gastro pub" is a bit misleading.  Nice selection of draft beers.  Interesting reading menu.  Doesn't taste nearly as good as it sounds.  We tried the grilled avocado with quinoa salad and the special soup - a curried crab bisque.  Either the head chef isn't properly training the line cooks to execute the recipes, or else they're afraid to offend delicate palettes with very flavorful food.    Altogether a disappointing experience.  It wasn't bad, but it could have been so much better.  I'll spend my money on better chef's efforts in future.

U99FkFRPMhYOQnWAVTi4uA.text: What a damn pleasant experience. Stopped in while traveling from Chicago and couldn't be happier. Excellent service (Heather was incredibly kind and helpful) a unique menu and great prices. Boom boom boom.

G60NzxDb0ecw3xSwHR1N-A.text: My boyfriend and I ordered "artichoke dip" with "crostinis" for an appetizer and it was more like bad hummus with stale toasted bread. My "pulled pork sandwich" was drenched in bad barbecue sauce on a stale bun. My boyfriend's "turkey reuben" was dry, bland and everything on the sandwich was all one color (tan). The beer I ordered was also stale. The whole place smells like a toilet.   Overall: F Minus.

q7gyva_tNihfBsLNvCiibw.text: The service and food were both amazing! I had the beef stroganoff  and my husband had the lamb curry. Both had wonderful flavors. If your in Homestead it is worth the trip here. Don't let the drab exterior scare you!

TPhU-S7Ku6xQGxlklUGPVQ.text: This place has classy bar food. I've been in the place as well as ordered through UberEats and both have always been delicious. The food combinations are spot on and its more than just burgers and fries.

SrPAVcxFXIeOIZDDvhPntA.text: I loved this unassuming pub -- looks like a bit of a dive on the outside situated right by the railroad track; walk inside and you'll notice their 30+ craft beer selection. The tables are nothing special and the lighting is dark, so you figure you're at a neighborhood watering hole.  ...but after receiving the menu, I was pretty giddy. Most things are under $10 with a mix of small plates, sandwiches and specials. I went with the "Porkzilla." With a name like that, how can you not?! Advertised on the menu as: house smoked and seasoned pork barbeque smothered with Muenster cheese on Italian bread, it did not disappoint. The pork was succulent and juicy, smokey and with a distinct flavor that you can only attribute to the fact that it was house made.  The salsa they serve the tortilla chips with was also OUT OF THIS WORLD! It had a smokey flavor. I don't think I've ever had smokey flavored salsa before, but I couldn't get enough of it. If they sold bottles of it, I would totally have bought some to take home. Blue Dust = solid choice for pub grub. They also have salads and healthy food options, which was an awesome surprise!

rW1k-GBNJGBNLJYgfC69rA.text: What can I say ,great food ,local bar pub, excellent beer, excellent service, great neighborhood bar feel .... if you don't stop by it's your loss....just go .... support local!!!

8n4PATgrH7kqUvNUQvtOow.text: Pleasant surprise in the Waterfront/Homestead area. We were on our way to a food truck rally which we ended up hearing about being oversaturated, so Yelp kindly diverted us to the close-by Blue Dust. We sat outside (which, in interest of full disclosure, was plus/minus based on frequency of nearby trains rolling through) and enjoyed an excellent draft selection. I got the chicken tacos, which exceeded expectations with a generous portion of spicy yet sweet filling. If you find yourself in the area looking for something a little off the main drag, Blue Dust might be your ticket.

Rl3QUwyZUL1C-EIBIwXG4A.text: This may be one of the best kept secrets in Pittsburgh. Although, based on reviews, it seems like a lot of people are discovering and appreciating the gloriousness of Blue Dust.   I'm a sandwich for dinner kind of gal. Always have been and always will be (low carb shmo carb- give been bread). I absolutely love all of the sandwich options here. Mix & match sliders are yummy and the honey teriyaki chicken wrap is great for those days I want to feel healthy. Also, I LOVE their red cabbage coleslaw. Sandwiches come with a choice of chips and salsa or coleslaw. I always order the coleslaw and they almost always bring me chips and salsa by mistake. This has happened 3 times... And now it's a running joke: Order the coleslaw, get chips and salsa, point out mistake to waitress and BAM! Suddenly I have chips, salsa, AND coleslaw. Can't complain about that spread!  They also offer some great dinner specials  (which are constantly changing) I had their beef brisket over mashed potatoes and it was delightfully delicious.  Bonus: this place infuses their own liquor so there's always something exciting in-house. I've tried their espresso and chai vodkas (one in coffee and one served up White Russian style) and they were both perfect after dinner treats.

DHXy9-pentMZFUk0y5CbnQ.text: If you need to a plan a private party, go to Blue Dust! Held my mom's 60th birthday there and it couldn't have been better! Stephanie the manager helped us every step of the way, and she even arranged for a bloody mary bar for us!!! The food was a hit with all the guests, even some fussy people who consider pepper a spice. All the employees were friendly and helpful, and kept the drinks flowing!   The infused vodkas are really good and they make a delicious pineapple mojito. The beers on tap are always good and they have a great selection.  I've been there otherwise, and the food has always been fantastic.  Consider Blue Dust for your party, hunger, and thirst needs!

4Z-1RO7fq_FZF_HEvP0J7A.text: My coworker and I were in Pittsburgh for a conference and were searching for an authentic, local restaurant to soak in the Pittsburgh scene (this was our first time traveling to this city!) We landed on this gatropub and really enjoyed our experience! The food was adventurous and delicious and the tap list was impressive. Our Sunday dinner experience was the same night as a Steelers home game, so the atmosphere was quiet, but it generally looked like a fun atmosphere to watch a game!  I would highly recommend the onion jam and feta on toasted baguettes!

iJBSemEC5GoQ9Jocm0uaZQ.text: this place is just great all around. great beer list, interesting menu, and friendly service. the kitchen is also open later which is perfect if you want to grab a bite after a movie.  oh, and they have homemade pierogies every tuesday which are fantastic!

h9akEfH8oCQbK7CSO6_niw.text: I was between a 3 and a 4 for this place. I came here with my husband for lunch on a summer weekday, and we each had the lunch special. I got a slider, crab bisque, and coleslaw.  I didn't really care for the slider. It was a little dry to me.  The crab bisque was good.  The coleslaw was really flavorful, and I appreciated that it wasn't made with mayo.  I think that was the best part of the lunch.  Usually the food is the most important part to me, and ambiance is much less important but I really felt awkward during lunch because we were the only people there that day. I think it was around 2 pm so maybe that was why but it still felt a bit un comfortable. I don't want to put too much weight on it though because we might have just been there at an off peak time/day.

J79M2G6nxqaNtL8iuLkL2A.text: Stopped by for Bloody Mary cocktails and brunch one Sunday after seeing an early movie. Nice little walk from Loews theatre. There is an incredible selection of homemade infused vodkas for the bloodies; like being a kid in a candy store trying to decide on one. Also had the nachos and they were so good and filling. One order was more than enough for two people to share.

HGIl_hHsRPEG6ApQIWYk7g.text: I always forget about Blue Dust; maybe it's because the Waterfront is on the other side of town; maybe it's because there are so many other awesome places in Pittsburgh! Whatever it is, I'm glad we picked this card from the City Dining Card Deck today!  Blue Dust has a dive bar atmosphere with a classy and sophisticated menu-a True juxtaposition, which I enjoy. Sort of a surprise, especially to those who haven't been yet.   We ordered from a diverse draft selection of several craft beers; their bottle selection is also very respectable, housing domestic and imported craft brews, some of which are normally a little more difficult to find.   The appetizers we ordered were the China Doll Chana Daal dip (lentil mash) and pita bread, and nachos with beef brisket. Both were outstanding! I particularly enjoyed the lentil chana dip (it was covered in fresh onions and tomatoes-great mix)!  Around the table, entrees were ordered that included the pulled pork sandwich, falafel salad, fish tacos, cranberry and walnut salad, and teriyaki chicken wrap. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals, but I will speak for myself when I say that the coleslaw recipe was weird, and not a good kind of weird. It needed more vinegar if that's the way they're going. Also, the chicken in the wrap was a bit overlooked and under sauced  Service was SO right-on. Server's name was Becky. What I loved most was that she knew the draft list and actually contradicted my very knowledgable husband! Loved it! Ha!  Good experience. We will return...again.

RMh-tCcGfNZJThCZBRFn6A.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed the Blue Dust!   This place is just outside of the waterfront in Homestead - you'd drive right past and never stop in unless someone told you to.  Well, consider yourself told.    The Blue Dust is a dive bar, but not.  They have a casual atmosphere with a great selection of drinks (regular bar stuff, a great craft beer list, plus everything from infused vodkas to seasonal sangrias to $60 glasses of aged bourbon).  The highlight though, is the food.  The menu has their standard fare and then there is usually a page of special items that change seasonally.  These items are out of the box selections that you order just because they are weird, but they delight every time.  All of the food packs a punch of flavor - no bland and boring meals here.  Portions are ample.  Sides are chips/salsa or cole slaw rather than the standard French fry option, which I appreciate.  I love fries and all, but it's nice to have something different.     All in all, the place is a strange combo of dive meets delicious that really works.  It's a go to when I want good food without all the fuss and pretention that you get at a lot of places.

8XMGjx21zqqvzSNAbed2IQ.text: Let's start this by saying I finally saw the always elusive 4oz snifter. That's right. snifter. Little tiny baby midget snifter. Of course it was filled with alcohol, a split in fact. Thanks for letting us share, it IS caring.    As it sat next to the mushroom arancini it made the balls look huge! They were delicious and properly portioned and the marinara, whether I know the reality or not, tasted like delicious house made stuff.   Not that it's an issue or anything, but my companion and I wondered how awkward it was to spin around to read the draft board. I would have just looked at the taps, but there was enough room between my bar spot and the draft wall that I would have had to get my driving glasses from the car to see them.   All in all though, the beer was delicious, the atmosphere was pleasant, the bartender was great, and the company amazing.

l7KqTqVby0vLWo6tBDlrSQ.text: I've driven past this place a gazillion times and never thought to stop in but thanks to the Yelp community and its positive reviews, I finally suggested it as a meeting place for a get together. Met some friends for a late dinner and wow, it was packed!  Blue Dust is a bar with a decent selection of craft beer but it also has a pretty decent food menu. I wasn't too hungry so I just shared some fried zucchini with the hubby while our friends both ordered the sliders. I can't speak on the taste of the sliders but they looked ok. The fried zucchini was probably the best I've tasted in a really long time. The zucchini is sliced lengthwise very thinly and it has a very thin batter. This combination makes a very crispy and light fried zucchini which was delightful. They are also generous with the marinara sauce which was a bit on the sweeter side, exactly how I like it.   The atmosphere was really fun. Everyone seemed to be having a great time which makes this place a great place to gather with friends. I will most likely stop here whenever I'm in the Homestead area from now on!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Fried zucchini

S5_90rXpjU0oBg9ZMv7-6w.text: Blue Dust is my go to when I'm looking for a quick bite to eat on the weekends and I was a good beer to go with it. Their beer selection and cocktails don't disappoint and their food has always been fantastic. They pretty much have an option for everyone from vegan to meat lovers. Their tacos are always on point and I love their hummus.

UOiwXWu0jzsdrsXjyRbqTw.text: Came here on a first date on a Friday. It seemed like a typical bar. It was nice that they had a parking lot.  Date ordered the portobella aracini, which were delicious with the sauce they served. I ordered the chicken BLT salad with their homemade blue cheese dressing and it was quite yummy. Date ordered smoke chicken legs, which were huge, and he also got. Aside salad with lemon ginger dressing which tasted amazing.  One complaint I have was with their horseradish pickle martini. It sounds really good but they make it too strong. Due to how powerful those flavors are, they should just enhance the standard martini, not be so powerfully competing that you can't even drink it. They gladly took it back and didn't charge and they were receptive to my feedback.  Only other issue is that there was no toilet paper in the ladies room.  I'd come back and try some other menu items. It's a chill, unpretentious, comfortable place

ntP6kBmnqVsrTiHDuxjLwQ.text: This is a neighborhood bar with 20+ beers on tap, but we generally go there for the food. This is a great "non chain" place to eat when you are at the Waterfront.  The sandwiches are yummy and filling.  We love pierogi night (fresh, homemade with caramelized onions).  We try to eat early because it can be noisy if they have a full house and if you go late on a Tuesday they might run out of pierogies.  The servers are accommodating and friendly.

fj6rUfL8foyUI9YH13iLdA.text: Sometimes I wait a few visits before I leave a review for a place because I want to know for sure that my reviews live in a state of reality and not hype.  I can honestly say after 5 visits here, Blue Dust is one of my favorite things about Homestead/WaterFront and maybe all of the 412 in general.  This is the type of place that you have to slowly peel back its layers a visit at a time.  Located at the entrance to the Waterfront it's an in your face location but somehow it's still, not!  You walk in it's dark, it's moody, it's someplace that makes you feel like there's more than meets the eye.  Off top they have a huge beer selection both on tap and in the cooler for take home.  IPA's, STOUTS, ALES, PORTERS and more.  Think FatHeads when you think about all the beers they have.  Now you'd think it was just a stellar beer place right?  Well, the food is another peeled back later adding to the allure.  I haven't had a lot of the menu yet and although I plan on continuing to peel back that specific layer, I can say this Falaffel is one of the best I've had around.  For $7.95 this dish is all you'd need to fuel you through the night of long drinking ahead because they got something even more special than beer, house infused vodkas!    Stuff like Honey, Pear, Cardamom; Wild Cherry, WaterMelon, Horseradish and many more that always rotate!  Get a house made mule and make sure you got a designated driver.    The deeper I get into this review, the more I realize I don't want to spoil the experience because I think that's what it is, something you need to take in yourself.  Go enough to where you build a relationship with Gus, then let me know what you think of this place.    This is HITTofMCM and Blue Dust is one of my elite watering holes for the weary mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

0-jSVDVOdHfp5s_TcSP-uw.text: Try the smashed chickpea chipotle tacos.  They are delicious.  Good beer selection, great cocktails, good music, friendly bar tenders, darts, pinball... One of my favorite spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

4r_1ddQmjfGCaBKZJnVWJQ.text: Visited today again for the first time in awhile.  Really good as always.  Great beer selection, and the drumsticks are dynamite.  A totally different experience than the typical beer places.

f5zydt2MMNPUGM8dAbTGPw.text: This remains one of our favorites, be sure to checkout their special events like Pumpkinfest and Oysterfest.

teoNuTp4dAVbx93cWxndDA.text: First time here for me. Love the options on the menu and there were great beers on tap- especially better since we arrived for half price happy hour before 7! Red bean dip & chips to start was very tasty.  My Falafel platter was the perfect size and the hubby had the brisket taco which he thoroughly enjoyed. Even had room for dessert of a warm cinnamon roll that satisfied my sweet tooth. Will definitely return when out this way again.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Stocked beer cooler

yVMuuAZjGbNbwI4Wc5n0tQ.text: Blue Dust rocks.   Jerry rocks.   Dollar haluski rocks.  Half off high end drafts rock.   Frank rocks.   Bloody Hoes rock (half off too!).   The servers rock.   The trains rock (literally).  The benches outside rock.   What's not to love?

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Bloody Hoe and Train!

CaMyVxJuudVdKQXgBLKqAA.text: I sooooo wish we had a neighborhood bar like this close to where I live. We were staying in Homestead near the chain restaurants but wanted to go someplace local - this did not disappoint. Great beer on tap (just like the sign says), friendly staff and great food. I had the Blue Dust salad and hubs had the brisket sandwich - both excellent!

HJDv4KU-EQjGKDviKEso6g.text: Very nice dive bar with live comedy shows on some days (at least on the day we went there was one). Nice selection of draught beer and not very pricey. Attentive bartenders and servers. The food isn't that great. We had wings, pizza, fish tacos, and bunch of stuff and nothing was super tasty and mediocre at its best. I might check them out again if am in the area and thirsty for beer but it's nothing I look forward to or will plan for.

USCzV94XnK-L-dEVxcw_nA.text: Both the food and drinks are amazing. 24 beers with yuengljng and Guinness being the only macro brew. Whisky list includes some hard to find, and some local. The blue dust manhattan proves I still have not mastered  this drink, and that's not for lack of trying.   Food also way good. We had shrimp diablo tacos and fish quesadilla. Both up there with the best mex we have had.   Great service from Heather. Friendly food suggestions and helped us find beer we liked.  Skip the big box in the waterfront and check it out.

judSLrqyQTXUsYKa2T_SVA.text: Love it here. Great craft beer selection plus house made infused alcohol. Always friendly crowd. Chill atmosphere. Do not hesitate to go. Oh and solid food menu.

2UGrtJCpX5S1bG9SiL0eJQ.text: Great beer selection and tasty menu options. The fish tacos are a favorite and I always like to see what is on the specials menu. Friendly staff and a comfortable place for lunch, dinner, happy hour, anytime. We like coming here on our bikes, on foot, or by car. It's hard not to stop when we're in Homestead.

HL92mirt50n7X76BBZ3CIg.text: Gosh, Blue Dust, why can't you be awesome all of the time? Every other time I've been to Blue  Dust they have been wonderful. Like a really great little pub with everything you could hope for when going out for a few drinks and food. The drinks have been flavorful, the beer selection has been extensive, and the food has been interesting and delicious. On other a few other occasions the service has been slow and the food has been disappointing.  We have brought out of town guests to Blue Dust twice now, and they weren't impressed on either of those occasions. My least favorite visit involved being at the restaurant for over an hour and a half (we had no intention of being there so long) during a seeming slow night at Blue Dust. That night we had disappointing and ridiculously boring and tasteless crab sliders, one of their dips, and a fish special that my boyfriend liked but I stopped eating after one bite. I haven't been back since because it really put a bad taste in my mouth (ha!) but I try to hold onto the fact that we had great experiences on more than one occasion.   On those other occasions we've had wonderful (and huge) fish tacos, mushrooms quesadillas, lobster Mac n cheese, super cheap bloody Mary's, flavorful scallops, good beer and unique cocktails. Most occasions the servers have been great and attentive. They also have a nice little outdoor patio area.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Artichoke dip

kAkgg8mSPemwUGF1GsLozg.text: I moved to Pittsburgh about 6 months ago and I am still finding new places to hang out. I recently stumbled upon Blue Dust while looking for a place I could get to without my car that wasn't in Squirrel Hill.  Let me start by saying the beer selection was awesome. I have been to quite a few places that are proud of the number of things on tap but fill them with lackluster options. This is not one of those places. The night I went in they had 3(+ depending on your definition) sours. Quite a few IPAs, browns, pales, lagers you name it. And none of the taps had "regular" beer (other than I maybe Guinness). The bartenders were very helpful with my selections and very knowledgeable. They were happy to give tasters, go into detail about what they knew about it and suggest new options if you're looking.   I had the brisket sandwich to eat which was very good. I preferred the horseradish to the bbq sauce though it was also good. The red cabbage cole slaw was very good, classic vinegar slaw. They had a large selection of more refined options as well which looked intriguing and inspired me to visit again including portobello arancini (which sounded great but was on special so I'm hoping it's there when I go back).   I gave it a 5 with two (very small) caveats (1) the growler prices were not listed though they advertised a growler bike rack and (2) the differentiation in the specials menu didn't separate starters/appetizers from mains.

jxwNPEcEzIf4QDoY2n_MLw.text: They have a small menu but some unique dishes. Their food is overall pretty good but sometimes leaves you feeling overly bloated when you leave. I always wonder what ingredients are in some things that cause that. Beware that the sound in the place can get very loud, so not a place to go with little ones or people with sensitive ears. Staff is super nice there.

wXYHW1QxCej-8ITPyz4fQg.text: Blue Dust has the best fish tacos in Pittsburgh! Not breaded , decent sized portion and very flavorful. You can get them with slaw or chips and a salsa (reccomended - it's smoky and delicious). They don't have a freezer or a fryer so the food is always fresh and usually lighter than what most restaurants offer. Menu isn't super large but I have never had something that I didn't like. Aside from the fish tacos, my fav thing is 25 cent pierogies on Tuesdays with a $2.50 mystery beer. Their motto is something along the lines of "no crap on draft" so you can't go wrong :)   If you can't find something on draft that you like, they have a huge bottle selection. The servers and bartenders are familiar with the different beers and  always helpful if you have trouble deciding.  The only thing that I don't love is the outdoor seating, it's on the same side of the building as the train tracks very close to them and the trains come roaring by pretty frequently.  Regardless, do yourself a favor and drive past the waterfront to come and check out this local gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Fish tacos with chips and salsa

F7lfq5uAxBHzrhSymQF3GA.text: Wa Just driving by and stopped in for lunch! What a great surprise. Service was good, food was fast and very good!  We had the Mac and cheese with pulled pork( which is smoked on the premises) and fried risotto balls with porta Bella mushrooms- delicious!  Will definitely stop back.

CVa3zPt_AdlPBKREn6x7xQ.text: The Blue Dust is great if you would like to go out for a sandwich and a great beer. I have eaten the beef brisket sandwich and loved it. It is smoked on premise by the owner.   My first visit here was before we went axe throwing that night. What a fun night! The selection of micro-brews is fantastic and they will give you samples if you aren't sure what you want. Since my first visit here, I have introduced Blue Dust to my friends and family and both loved it. We have been back several times.  This is a great place for a moderately priced night out. It is not fancy but it sure is a fun place to go with friends or even alone. Very casual, unhurried atmosphere.  They are located in Homestead just to the south of the Waterfront. So, if your are going to the Waterfront, skip the chain restaurants and go for a real Pittsburgh experience.

aHAJM3kW736qrhdk2hV65Q.text: I really like this place. It is in the up-and-coming Homestead neighborhood. I predict it will be the next Lawrenceville of the Pittsburgh area. They have a huge selection of craft beers both in bottles cans and on tap. I have not tried the food there but I hear it's very good. You can watch local sports on the several big screen TVs inside or you can sit outside on a couple of tables they have and watch the very loud trains go by. If your train fan, This is a great spot. I believe it is called blue dust because it is in the former steel mill Area along the Monongahela River. The workers would be covered in the blue dust when they got home from work. Definitely recommend it. Try the east and monkey boy If they still have it on tap when you arrive.

ldUN4XLsZCrJHqRIFU8QDw.text: Blue Dust has a dive bar feel with a very interesting menu! They have crab and brisket all over the menu. I had the chicken club sandwich and it was great! On sundays they have half off bloody Mary's! They also have great food presentation and the service was also good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Chicken club sandwich

nhV5iblzEBkw7N8n2nPA3g.text: Best corner of the Waterfront and probably predates it. Well-executed bar drinks with creative twists, and a nice selection of tasteful meals and apps. I am not a fan of the term gastropub - but this place has met the bar since well before the latest fads, with local ambience, the occasional freight train rumbling right by outside, and fast and attentive and personable staff.

FZKTdTMAZZ3-TAYiYAb8XA.text: If you're searching for a local non-chain option around the waterfront at lunchtime, Blue Dust is your spot. They have a plethora of yummy, and surprisingly healthy sounding options at reasonable lunchtime prices. I visited at noon on a Friday, and there was only one other table of customers present at that time. Service was quick and friendly, and I loved that they have a parking lot onsite with free parking. I got a squash hash and it was pretty good, but a little dry and defiantly not a large portion size. It felt like a healthy, light lunch option, and I definitely appreciated the spread of options they had for their lunchtime offerings. I'll def be back, next time probably for happy hour!

bcKSfVFH6UZK5p0L60sdnQ.text: We stopped here for a few drinks and dinner before we went to see a show a few miles down the road at the Carnegie Library of Music Hall.  There were some other places we were looking to eat at but looking at their reviews here we saw that it was up and down so we gave them a shot.       On yelp it says they have a private parking lot and they do but it isn't too big.  We drove in and it was full so we had to find street parking about 5 minutes away walking.  We walked in and it was busy but we found two seats at the bar.  I thought it smelled funny in there.  Looking around and getting situated I figured out we were just really at a bar that had a food menu.         We were greeted by the bartender and ordered a few beers.  The beer that we wanted just kicked but we found a couple ones that we liked.  We knew what we wanted already because we looked at the menu beforehand.  My wife got the fish tacos and I ordered the brisket tacos.  They both came with either coleslaw or chips and salsa.  At first it was loud in here but people started leaving and it was only about half full by the time our food came.         Our food came out and it looked good.  They gave me coleslaw by mistake so they went back to get me some chips and salsa.  The salsa was ok.  My wife's taco was really runny.  She tipped it over and a lot of liquid came out of it.  She had to get another plate.  I did like my brisket tacos.  3 out of 5 I would rate my tacos.  The meat was a little dry but the flavors were all there.  Once all of the liquid was out of my wife's tacos I think she liked them too but they were really average.  We were hungry...       So we would come back here to have a drink if there wasn't anything else open.  I think the customer service was good.  They made sure our food was good.   It's a bar which is fine but I really wouldn't recommend eating here for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Brisket Tacos

EHmmgBFzsyKKdYrnP-ZblQ.text: If you're shopping at the Waterfront/ Homestead - or just passing through- you gotta stop at Blue Dust. It's such an unique spot!   I love everything about this place. We stopped for some appetizers before heading to Kennywood a few weeks ago. We got there around 12:20pm - it wasn't busy- so we got seated right away.   I ordered the bourbon cocktail to drink - it was delicious! I might have ordered more than one! They also have a wonderful draft list of yours in the mood for a beer.   For an appetizer- I split the nachos & the fried zucchini with one of my co-workers. They were both delicious & we ate them all up. I would definitely order them again, but I would love to try the tacos!   I will definitely be back to visit Blue Dust again soon! If you're in the area - you definitely have to check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

YSweiHMUgIsO-Kr7G_6yQA.text: Absolutely a great spot! Atmosphere, Draft Choices, Menu (with vegan and vegetarian options)...topped off with great service!

CxJWVK-2ZqphAVZGcwmpxw.text: This place employs some type of Harry Potter-style magic, (Perhaps an Undetectable Extension Charm?) because as inconspicuous and tiny as it looks on the outside, the interior is cozy and sort of rustic.  I feel like most of what I've heard about Blue Dust is about their fantastic house cocktails. They make infusions and syrups in house, and use good liquor.  The seasonal Pumpkin Chai Martini was a highlight on my trip: A Dessert drink at its finest, the drink was smooth but strong.  I also went half for half on wraps with my boyfriend... We split the Heat and Honey Teriyaki Chicken Wrap and the Portobello Wrap. He opted for the house tortilla chips and salsa, and I went for the coleslaw. The wraps were both fairly good, although we both wished they had been a bit bigger. The coleslaw was very tasty, and vinegar based instead of mayo based (my preference!)  All in all, the experience was a good one. Our waiter was a bit elusive, but to be fair, we were here around 2 PM... So maybe it was just off timing on our part?  I'd recommend Blue Dust if you're in the area and craving good cocktails and lovingly prepared food.

0wV5iLzm73jIpK_WxY5nig.text: This place is my go-to for after sports hangout with the team. The place usually has plenty of seating and great service. You gotta check out the specials menu because that's where the best menu items are found. Highly recommend!

p4uTrOmeih24Gp2u9StRMA.text: Decent amount of drafts listed on their draft menu, too bad they were out of a few, most specifically the ones I was leaning to.  I can't say my first impression of this place was overall positive and that impression lasted through out our entire experience spanning ever part of our visit.   Boasting 20+ draft list was probably the most impressive thing about this place.  It was very busy on a Saturday around 6.  We found some vacant bar stools on the one end of the bar.  We quickly snagged them up and from there things progressively got worse.  The stools were in bad shape.  Ripped, wobbly, and sticky.  There was a urine smell to the place.  I can't say if it was because the bathrooms were behind us or if someone had pissed in the corner the night before.  Where ever it was coming from it was off putting.  We ordered a round of drinks once we narrowed down what they had and got the attention of the bustling bartender.  Our initial bartender was very nice but she left shortly after we got there and was replaced by who I believe was either an owner or manager combo man and women team that were not as friendly.  We were very hungry having come there not just for a drink but dinner before seeing a show up the road.  I ordered the fish tacos and my husband also got tacos.  They came out quickly and really looked great!  Until I picked them up...  Talk about using frozen fish and not getting the water out.  Water was pouring out of the tacos like a fountain.  This wasn't a drip, it was more of a pool.  I tilted my water laden taco toward the plate and watched for a minute as my taco drained onto the plate below.  Bartenders must have seen me doing this, as I had to ask for another plate, but never made one comment to me.  I was so irritated but still very hungry and did not want to send my food back based on time constraints and quite honestly I believed I would probably not receive any better food.  After I filled a whole plate with fish water I salvaged what I could from this dish and ate my meal.  It was not very good.    To sum up the evening I had to use the restroom.  Odd setup of a smelly bathroom topped with a heavy and quick to slam bathroom door that clipped my heals and smacked my butt on the way out.   Yea I don't think we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

uwVBscWepbIfL_xrDnUE6A.text: This food was so good that I felt inspired to write my very first Yelp review. The curry crab soup was, with no hyperbole, the best soup I've ever had. It was chock full of shredded crab, and the base is reminiscent of Mrs Grass' broth, mixed with a warm (but not overpowering) curry accent. My S/O and I ordered the brisket tacos to share, and they actually brought it out as a split plate..what service! The brisket was tender, juicy and flavorful and mixed well with the toppings of shredded cheese and crema sauce. Add to that the large selection of awesome craft beers, and this is definitely a place I'll be returning to! Wish I could post a picture of the delicious food, but after one bite here it's hard to stop till the plate is empty!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

lb7G8HQm4Irx1kMCPoIPHg.text: This is a cool little place with a very neighborhood bar feel, but also with a great selection of beers and a good selection of basic bar foods, made with a nice twist.  It also has a few pinball machines if you like the silver ball... and it looks like they have a little local music scene, although I have not been around to see who they have play.  I stopped by a new times after work and enjoy it every time. Doesn't look impressive from the outside, but then you are not paying for fancy ambiance either.

_PpVhtYA1td8GlcLYMTjdw.text: Very good . Came in for lunch had sandwiches and the house made chips/salsa. The Curry crab bisque was  amazing not sure if I'd call it a True bisque, regardless it was good. My next trip here I'd get the tacos or possibly the wings, the table next to us had both and they look GREAT. Not to mention the beer selection got to make sure I'm come off the clock haha

346m0fd3r6RpLFnRXmJ35A.text: This is a really nice place close to the waterfront. A group of us came here while doing a bike ride along the great Allegheny passage. Even though the place looks run down from the outside, the inside is really nice. They have like 26 beers on tap - and really good ones.   I tried the group lamb filled pepper, which was delicious. This place is definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Tap list

jdcAmyx50PpIFyLG_QIGNA.text: Blue Dust is definitely something different! I love how incredibly close it is to the train tracks. It is decently small inside and looks like a dive bar (almost), but their menu is what sets them apart from being just some bar that serves food. I was not a huge fan of the atmosphere at first but I gave it a chance.   Fridays are busy and I was really surprised that when I was trying to order food and drinks, half of the things I ordered were sold out. Like completely gone! That is why I gave it this rating.   I got a falafel platter and it was so dry. The falafel balls themselves were quite good but it was served with giant wedges of vegetables and dry, bland pita. The appetizers were great though. I wanted the artichoke dip but ended up getting the chana daal dip, which was soooo delicious. I would love to go back and try to taste what they didn't have. Maybe an updated review will happen at a later time.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Coconut curry bar nuts!
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. What is left of the chana daal dip (sorry guys, too delicious!!)
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Falafel platter

XtEogSKZIfX1JMoVwvzdiA.text: Blue Dust is one of my favorite beer bars in Pittsburgh.  The selection, simplicity and ease of access is what really makes it great.  They have a great selection of beers, liquor and infused liquors.  The food is good and menu changes periodically.  They also have the ability to take out a custom six pack from the coolers.  The staff is also excellent and always consistent.  For a fun evening out with friends, where you can sit, talk, drink outside and watch trains fly by... it's unmatched.

8U3OfWZAlR-IOXG7NeNfcA.text: Really, all I should have to say is beef brisket nachos. The tap rule on their beer selections is brilliant and though bourbon is personally not my thing, the creativity is refreshing. My husband and I have been coming here for several years now, it was a favorite date spot before we were Mr. & Mrs. Now we have kiddos, we barely go anywhere let alone someplace as cool as Blue Dust, but the brisket nachos keep beckoning to return promptly.  No seriously... the nachos are drool-worthy, amaz-a-licious.

k5yS3NjTsZ20d26JsEQaWA.text: Best food in the waterfront. Best beer in the waterfront. Best staff in the waterfront. (And it looks like best mixed drinks, as well.) (And the cheapest good food, by far.)  If you're in the waterfront, you should go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Great taps.

2xfVQsyQ0JEl5PHw-KRcLw.text: The draft list is bananas amazing! So good. Great environment. Love sitting outside and watching the trains to by in the summer.

x7tNS_YYdq466hGn14SH8A.text: Blue Dust is a great place to hang out. They have a really great happy hour where all beers on tap (and they always have a ton) are half off. The brews are great if you love craft beer. They food is also really, really good. I love the Porkzilla sandwich and the Falafel small plate. They also have pierogi and haluski nights, where you can get a small plate of pierogis or haluski for only one or two dollars. I love the dart board. Always have to play a few rounds every time I'm there.

2XRGa_XiMBGxDiag6iAm0Q.text: Nice selection at beers at prices that don't empty your wallet. It seems like the staff really thinks about their beer list because there is a choice to fit every taste.   Speaking of the staff, they are really friendly and a group of us chatted with the bartenders the entire evening as the Homestead trains chugged by right outside the window.  Didn't try any food, except for some of the snacks they have pickling behind the bar. Try the pickled radishes. (I know it sounds weird, but they are awesome)

Dl06pnwWfU1JwucgR-bS9w.text: Beer and brisket.  What more can I say?  Went based on recommendation of a friend.   I can't tell you how many times I've driven past this place on the way to the Waterfront and always wondered.  I'm glad I went!  We both loved the brisket and the beer selection was excellent.  Server was super nice, and the environment was very laid back bar environment.  Not too loud/rowdy and not too quiet.    The salsa had more garlic than I have ever eaten in a single sitting, which may be my only food-related complaint, but it was freshly made so I'm going to attribute it to single batch mistake.  Check this place out!

eA7B-tV08f6_g5bw5tIBHA.text: In the shadow of The Waterfront, the nooks and crannies of Homestead contain some hidden gems: Blue Dust is one of them.  I loved the beer selection and the atmosphere - so why not more stars? The execution of my sandwich, ordered off the specials list, left a little to be desired. Smoked chicken and white barbeque sauce? Yes, please. But rye bread as the carrier meant that the lovely smoke and sauce was overwhelmed with all rye, all the time, and there were no other accompaniments (lettuce, tomato) to mediate.  Ordering off the specials menu anywhere can be a gamble, because they're often dishes in the process of being refined, rather than tried-and-True stalwarts. My husband's brisket, a menu standard, was delicious.  I'll definitely go back, because I want to eat at a place that's both comfortable and inventive - even if it's not perfect.

MhMPvn_51dbxmmMv4zYibw.text: What a great place. Amazing beer selection, dog friendly area outside, phenomenal food and great staff. Will absolutely be back here many many times. Love it.

3-9nywlCOHRtMiVx6iKUmA.text: This place flies under the radar for sure. The beer selection is stellar and happy hour (half off taps and apps) is from 5-7. I got the hummus and pita, which was plentiful and flavorful. Will be back again... And again

7N0TD94qIRGfXYiyV1y2Cg.text: I think they have diminished the quality of their food. I went there several times a while back and had very tasty food, but this past time I went, the brisket was not particularly impressive. It seems that they've added more to their menu but at the expensive of the quality of the food.

rW-QSLYSBRK6pQ5SNMr1lA.text: Comfortable.  Simple.  Amazing.  Blue Dust is my favorite bar because of the above adjectives.  Walking in, you see an open room with tables and a cozy bar.  Turning towards the door you notice an area to play darts and Rock'em Sock'em Robots (epic).  Turning in the other direction you notice the myriad of refrigerators full of quality beer.  Similarly, there are a dozen or so beers on tap, all of which are top notch.  Also, they have bacon bourbon and it is crazy.  The menu is very simple, containing a few staple appetizers, salads, small plates, and sandwiches.  The gold, however, is in the monthly specials.  The first time I ever visited Blue Dust they had braised short ribs as the special--short was a loose term, very loose term.  If I had to guess, I'd say each rib weighed a half pound each and I was served three, and all of the meat was falling off the bone.  The February special is pulled mutton; the only other time I've had mutton was at Blue Dust.  Both times were fantastic.  If you want a special, go a week or so into the month until the last few days of the month.  I've gone when they were still waiting on ingredients on the first of the month and after they'd run out of some towards the end of the month.  Tuesdays are pierogie night.  They're made in-house, are amazing, and sell out.  My only complaint is their salsa served with their sandwiches is strange.  Not my style, but maybe somebody likes it.  Go there, grab a brew, and chow down.  You won't regret it.

0PWxzyXT9idtoKQDk3vChA.text: Really creative food.  Outside of building is deceiving.  Cool murals painted on the walls.  Loved the 3 slider options with 5 choices of meat.  Chocolate stout cake was delicious.  Definitely will go back.

DflcDAiGNhhps6A_r0za4g.text: We stopped for lunch on a Saturday during a lengthy bike ride.  Ate outside and got to enjoy the trains going by!  Food was excellant and service was great.  Nice to sit outside and watch the activities.  Menu had many options.  A must try and will be back!!

kvzoDZvXseQfF6nQfe2p8g.text: If there were 2.5 stars, I'd probably go with that -- but since that's not an option I'll err on the side of generosity and/or give a extra half-point for the horseradish and pickle-infused vodkas which were really nice.  Yelp lists this as a "Gastropub"; based off of that definition and the consistent 4-star rating I was expecting much more.  The Tuesday night special $0.25 pierogis were definitely the highlight.  The other food I ordered ranged from not good to not great.  The arancini were extremely greasy.  The curry crab bisque was strange (and not a bisque by my standards,) and the salad was basically lettuce with some craisins thrown on top (no almonds as advertised.)  If I were to return, I'd get a plate of pierogis and call it a day.  However, it's unlikely that I would.  As I mentioned earlier, they have some really interesting infused vodkas so my recommendation would be to eat elsewhere and stick with the booze.

bZ0nflewI7_pvMLOFcJ4RA.text: Great place tucked away in Homestead!  Great beer selection.  Good food menu.  Good service.

yIALadfVEliKBcJC8xNRxA.text: Outstanding customer service. The horseradish infused bloddy mary was the best I have ever had. Food was excellent and fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Best Bloody Mary ever!
Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States

ySGK2cWvjqVBSAJEurmoig.text: One of the more nuanced beer selections in Pittsburgh.  This is THE place to be during PGH beer week. Of special note is the infused vodkas.  I had a bloody mary and boy howdy was it great.  Freshly made with homemade horseradish infused vodka.  HOOK IT UP TO MY VEINS.    It's probably the best bloody mary I have ever had.  And to think, at a dumpy bar next to the railroad tracks!  This is why Pittsburgh is such a magical place.  So unassuming but BAM POW something amazing somewhere humble.   The bacon bourbon was also superlative.  Do get the maple syrup in it (just a touch, the bartender will add the perfect amount) it gives it more depth and balances out the salt.  Unfortunately what really kills Blue Dust for me is the food.  The food is not good.   IT IS PAINFULLY AVERAGE.  I was grateful for my sandwich after a few beers but I was astonished to discover that they served CANED SALSA AND TORTILLA CHIPS FROM A BAG as my side.  Not even fresh chips? Not even fries?    Christ on a crutch, that's bad.  The sandwich itself was warm and melty and full of supermarket quality meat.  It lacked flavor, however it was completely inoffensive and a vehicle to deliver carbs, cheese and meat to my gullet.  I go back every chance I get for the new infused vodkas and the ever changing beer.  A hidden gem.

v_t5enks9sRK6H2yIbxATQ.text: After reading some of the reviews, maybe too much was expected...the bar was set too high. The actual experience? It was okay.  What wasn't okay was the sewer smell as you came through the door, but at least that disappeared once past the vestibule.  We bellied up to the bar all ready to experience an infusion or two- how could we resist after all we'd heard? It was early evening on a Saturday...no horseradish infused, no jalapeno infused, but they had pickle infused vodka...sounded good! Eh...not even close to a great bloody Mary. It was adequate.   The bartender chick with the sideways ballcap recommended the chai infusion in a white Russian to my companion. Wow that sounded amazing! In actuality it was overly sweet, overly creamy (yes, that's possible) and simply not a well-made cocktail. It was big. That was a shame because a drinking glass full went almost untouched....and the ballcap chick never inquired why.   We paid our check and left. Nothing of the first round enticed us to stay for another. The atmosphere? Eh. That kind of summarizes the whole experience. Maybe if you don't expect much, you won't be disappointed. We were.

zHpx7_r3qwVwWPKk893K0Q.text: Great beer selection. Don't let the exterior fool you! It's nice inside.

5pOz1XTMSmXAhBDvLUaICw.text: The house local infused vodkas were delicious!! I can't imagine a Bloody Mary without horseradish infused vodka!  I had the brisket sandwhich and it was basic and delightful! This place is a gem in a sea of waterfront generic food. Eat and drink here! #lovehomestead

HhrD0NwXcmc5f5aH-RigtA.text: The atmosphere is nice and the beer selection is good, but the food is mediocre and the service is terrible. My boyfriend and I arrived at 7:15pm on $0.25 pierogi night but they were already sold out of pierogies, despite the fact that the place only appeared to be half full. It left us feeling like the 25 cent pierogies were a cheap advertising gimmick to get people in the door and then order much more expensive food off the menu.  Speaking of food, the turkey on my boyfriend's ruben sandwich was dry and the bread was meh. He said that the only good thing about it was that it was huge. My group's nachos were burned black on one side and my grilled cheese sandwich was so rich that it wasn't edible for more than a few bites. Don't get me wrong, I love me some cheese, but the thick layer of goat cheese combined with a healthy dose of two other cheeses made for a sandwich that dries out your mouth and leaves you super thirsty. Also, it hadn't been cooked long enough to melt any of the cheese, and didn't have any basil on it as described on the menu.   The service was pretty bad - it took about 15 minutes for anyone to come take our order, and then our waiter forgot about our drinks. He was also difficult to flag down, which was understandable given how busy the place got throughout the night. I wouldn't have been so annoyed by the bad service if our group hadn't been charged the mandatory 18% gratuity after being told our checks couldn't be split. If you're going to charge a mandatory gratuity, at least provide that level of service! We left feeling like our waiter didn't bother because he knew he'd be getting an 18% tip.

9_L0N54GzQYyU5TxUNNv0g.text: It's a hole in the wall with a fantastic beer selection. I've revamped this review as I've come here a few more times and it's grown on me.  It's off the beaten path of the waterfront, located across the tracks towards Eighth Ave. next to a tattoo parlor on Amity Street.   I'd heard a lot about this place as well as read just about every review on Yelp and newspaper reviews. I wasn't sure what to expect, but a dark, dank, Burgh bar wasn't it.   I was highly impressed with the bar, any brand of vodka, flavored, proof, etc, bacon bourbon, and a nice selection of beers. I had a black IPA, which was awesome with the Spicy China Doll (a thick pasty bean dip that could have used a bit of salt) served with very good tortilla chips that's weren't a bit greasy. For Dinner I had a portobello wrap, it was nice and meaty but lacked basic salt and pepper seasoning.  Neither the app or wrap really stood out in my mind.   The fish tacos are some of the best in the burgh. Moist grilled tilapia are wrapped around soft flour tortillas, drizzled with cilantro creme and nested in crunchy cabbage. Delicious! Served up with an oil and vinegar slaw that works well with the tacos. Pair it up with a wheat beer or classic IPA for some serious eats.

UoxQ_t4gaHw2kc2K96jcbw.text: Great selection of beer. Smoked chicken legs are the best! Pierogi night on Tuesdays is a good value. Beer can be pricey, but the selection is endless. Bloody Mary on a Sunday is fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Dust - Homestead, PA, United States. Erie Johnny Rails Pumpkin

OFpKLmMFw6u7tdJWK1drSQ.text: For beer, absolutely a place to visit.  For the food, I've usually stuck with the appetizers.  But recently, the 'dip' that I ordered was almost frozen solid, and the pita chips that came with it were chewy and tasteless.

xQ8XokZK6Y53QqIUy0Yb2A.text: It's just the best bar good in pittsburgh. Vegan options too. Great staff. All around best.

0LXOq9KxYiyKxF3qWNbq5g.text: Blue dust is truly a hidden gem. They have a great beer selection. The food is outstanding, far better than one would expect from a bar. Ive always had excellent food and service here. Great bar for happy hour, every day of the week. Ill always drop in for a beer when im in the neighborhood

ovfyVAbELnXPJzNSlgfFXw.text: Blue Dust ALWAYS has good beers. They have a great selection of infused vodkas. My husband is a beer expert and he lives to come here to see what they have in tap and to make a 6 pack.  Their food is definitely not your typical bar food. They have seasonal items on their menus as well as their regular dishes. For example they are offering pumpkin hummus as well as Fisherman's Stew during these falling temperatures. One of my favorite dishes is their version of "surf and turf". It is done as two halves of sandwiches-one half being crab cake and the other being brisket. There is very little filler in the crab cakes and the brisket is very tasty. Their homemade salsa is really good too.  Try it!!!  Great beer and great food!

c-_v0tTBCdi1ykls_13qig.text: The variety of food is amazing. There are many healthy options and everything is homemade and delicious. The beer selection is awesome and the tap's are wide ranging. There are many unique spirits with a seasoned twist, or Kimchi Vodka, Chai Vodka and Peach Habanero Tequila to name a few. Prices are fair and service is great.

5nzAItXsgrzvgiyWp2KlCQ.text: We went to Blue Dust, as suggested by several Yelpers, before seeing a movie at the Waterfront.  So we got there early on a Saturday night.  Private parking lot. Check.  It's a really big bar inside - no separation of bar and dining area.  The service was great and the music was LOUD at first, then somewhat softer (better).  Arsenal Cider on tap - always a plus!  Yes, please!  Although I wanted the "land and sea" I've read so much about, it just seemed too big, so I opted for the grilled three cheese sandwich with slaw.  The sandwich was fabulous and had basil - which I liked a lot (also tomato which was plucked 'n chucked as is the case with most tomatoes in February).  Companion had the portabella wrap with chips and salsa - also a hit.  The service was happy and as attentive as necessary for a quick bite.  There are large windows behind the bar and 3-4 times through our short visit the trains roared past.  Now this is a part of Pittsburgh and the surrounding area I love - the trains!  So that was a plus for me, but maybe not for everyone (might play a part in the music volume, too).  Definitely would go back - next time skipping lunch or going to a late movie, as the "land and sea" is softly singing in the back of my mind.

YjQUoEGcT-vxPuXE1uijCg.text: Found this place by accident and loved it! Cool venue, Pittsburgh centric, non-chain. Really fresh food...hot pastrami and bbq port tacos were perfect.  Great onion straws, light batter and not overly greasy. Best part,  infused vodkas and gin for 1/2 price martinis on Sunday. Will definitely go back. Good beer selection, no crap, as their sign says!

w4mfaBfAlF7g9UhEUnvOSA.text: I can't believe that I have been driving right past this place for over a year and I never tried it. I visited yesterday for lunch on a whim and was seriously impressed. The atmosphere is pretty dive-y, but the food is delicious! They also have a really awesome selection of beer on tap. Be warned, the Blue Dust slogan is "no crap on tap" and they aren't kidding. Don't expect to find any Budweiser, Miller, Coors, or Yuengling on tap here. They did have Guinness on tap, and you can take that for what it is. Draft prices are pretty reasonable (around $6), especially compared to other places on the Waterfront with decent beer (Burgatory, Rock Bottom).   I started with one of the soups of the day, curry crab bisque, and was blown away. It was spicy and flavorful with some decent crab. I ordered a bowl and the portion was really generous--bigger than the bowls in my own kitchen. My boyfriend got the grilled chicken appetizer with barbeque sauce and was impressed with the quality of the chicken and sauce.  For my lunch I got the 3 cheese sandwich, which comes with fresh basil and tomato. I asked if they could add onion and they did so for free. It was very good, but not great. I guess it's hard to blow people away with a cheese sandwich, so no worries. My boyfriend got the pulled pork sandwich ("porkzila") and loved it. He said he intends to go back and order the same thing. A friend was also impressed with his hot italian sandwich, which looked to have a generous portion of meat and cheese. Sandwiches come with either chips and salsa or cole slaw (the vinegar kind, not the mayo kind). The salsa is a basic pico, but I really liked it. I didn't try the cole slaw.   I liked this place a lot and will definitely go back to try some of their other options. Reasonably priced beer on tap is enough of a draw by itself.

nqxc620D2IoYa87GRs617w.text: The Blue Dust is really growing on me. Stoped in yesterday did lunch. I did not expect to be back in so soon. My wife said I was on my own for dinner. Since I was passing on my way home from Bradford, so an omen from the beer god's. This restaurant is a treasure on Homestead. Sarah is the co-owner and chef of the place. Her palate is amazing. Take a look at the menu on threir web site at BlueDustPgh.com - not what you would expect from the unassuming location. Opening in 2009, I just found them 2 months ago. Tonight I am having the falaffel. Now don't be thinking I am a connisoure of this cusine. The dish is tender and nicely spiced. Do you like smoked meats? The briscuit is awesome. $0.25 pierogies on Thursday with half priced berets and $1.00 haluski are the bomb. Check out the daily specials from my photo. Give the place a try and you will be hooked. Tell Jerry (the other owner you saw my review on Yelp and you will recieve a hearty welcome - peace out
